item.title: Stock Funds Zoom to 9.1% Gain in First Quarter
item.description: Start to year was even better than hoped. Also: A flashback to the 30th anniversary of the Kidder Peabody bond scandal.

item.title: Do Kwon Lost to the SEC. The U.S. Is Piling Up Other Crypto Wins, Too.
item.description: The decision was the latest in a series of federal court wins bolstering regulators’ efforts to force the freewheeling industry to comply with the same laws that govern the stock and bond markets.

item.title: Big Tech Has a Big Cash Problem
item.description: Any acquisitions companies such as Apple, Amazon or Microsoft attempt will bring scrutiny and delays.

item.title: The Surprising Top Mutual Fund in the First Quarter
item.description: Hennessy Cornerstone Growth claims the No. 1 spot over the past year as small-to-midcap funds start to supplant the dominant large-cap growth funds.

item.title: Hash Out the Inheritance Now, or Fight Your Family Later
item.description: The toughest part of estate planning isn’t writing the will, but talking about it openly with the family.

item.title: Biotech Executive Who Bet on Rival's Stock Committed Insider Trading, Jury Says
item.description: The SEC won its “shadow trading’” case, extending the application of the law.

item.title: Am I Glad I Went to College? Well, It's Complicated
item.description: I never got my degree and I have lots of student debt. And yet…

item.title: Luxury Brands Go Shopping for Upmarket Boutiques
item.description: Big luxury companies have spent more than $9 billion on real estate since the start of 2023.

item.title: The Newest College Athlete Endorsement Deal: Being the Face of a Bank
item.description: Marketing officials are signing up student athletes to help pitch their accounts. “These athletes are very appealing to work with.”

item.title: Why the Stock Market Keeps Changing Its Story
item.description: Exxon’s surge is an important shift in the market, a new narrative that investors would be wise to pay close attention to—in case it changes again.

item.title: The Score: Trump Media, Walt Disney, Ulta Beauty and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: Heard on the Street's Stock-Picking Contest
item.description: Read about our columnists’ favorite and least-favorite stocks and see how they have performed.

item.title: Strong Jobs Report Triggers Stock Rally
item.description: The monthly employment report rekindled stock-market gains that had languished in recent sessions.

item.title: A Smart Twist on One of the Stock Market's Dumbest Ideas
item.description: Chipotle’s 50-for-1 stock split is a clever step that will help turn more of its employees into shareholders.

item.title: From Granolas to Fab Five, Market Looks for Europe's Magnificent Seven
item.description: Market strategists are searching for a European answer to the Magnificent Seven—they just can’t agree on which stocks to pick.

item.title: Strong Jobs Report Still Leaves Wiggle Room for the Fed, but Not Much
item.description: The expanding supply of workers lets the economy add jobs without overheating, but will that be enough to keep rate cuts on track?

item.title: Do Bond Ladders Really Work?
item.description: Research finds a laddering strategy delivers comparable gains as reinvesting bonds each year—with reduced volatility and less downside

item.title: Robinhood Sets Sights on New Bounty: The Rising Rich
item.description: Recent moves by the online brokerage hint at ambitions in wealth management.

item.title: The Hot Sale Going on at Department Stores: Their Shares
item.description: Private buyers might have more stomach for the struggling retail sector than jaded stock investors.

item.title: SBF Is Going to Prison, but the Fight Over Money at FTX Drags On
item.description: The crypto exchange’s collapse is still a source of anger and frustration for many onetime customers, more than a year later.
